content.description: <math alttext="C O gas plus 2 H 2 gas is in equilibrium with C H 3 O H gas; K sub c equals 11" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>CO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Substance Initial Concentration (<math alttext="molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) <math alttext="C O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.10 <math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.10 <math alttext="C H 3 O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.10 The table lists the initial concentrations of each substance in the system represented by the equation above at a given temperature. Which of the following best predicts what will occur as the system approaches equilibrium?

choices.label: The rate of the reverse reaction will be less than the rate of the forward reaction, and additional <math alttext="C H 3 O H gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be consumed because <math alttext="K sub c is less than Q sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The rate of the reverse reaction will be greater than the rate of the forward reaction, and additional <math alttext="C H 3 O H gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be consumed because <math alttext="K sub c is less than Q sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The rate of the forward reaction will be less than the rate of the reverse reaction and, additional <math alttext="C H 3 O H gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced because <math alttext="K sub c is less than Q sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The rate of the forward reaction will be greater than the rate of the reverse reaction, and additional <math alttext="C H 3 O H gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced because <math alttext="K sub c is less than Q sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The rate of the reverse reaction will be greater than the rate of the forward reaction, and additional <math alttext="C H 3 O H gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be consumed because <math alttext="K sub c is less than Q sub c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
